meanings.definition: Free from disease or infirmity; robust; vigorous.
meanings.sent1: The old dog was surprisingly hale and energetic for his age.
meanings.sent2: She admired the hale oak tree standing tall in the park.
meanings.sent3: Despite his hale appearance, he was actually quite clumsy.
meanings.sent4: The hale laughter of the children filled the playground with joy.
meanings.sent5: The hale horse galloped gracefully across the field.

meanings.definition: To pull or draw forcibly; to haul.
meanings.sent1: He had to hale the heavy box up the stairs.
meanings.sent2: The fishermen haled the net out of the water with great effort.
meanings.sent3: She tried to hale the stubborn donkey along the path.
meanings.sent4: The storm winds haled the ship towards the rocky shore.
meanings.sent5: The workers haled the cart filled with bricks to the construction site.

meanings.sent1: The teacher had to hale the students to the assembly hall.
meanings.sent2: The shepherd haled the sheep back to the pen before nightfall.
meanings.sent3: The aroma of freshly baked cookies haled him into the kitchen.
meanings.sent4: The music haled the crowd to the dance floor.
meanings.sent5: The scent of flowers haled her towards the garden.
